meaningMnemonic: The 気持ち (feeling) is <kanji>bad</kanji>. So, you can imagine how you feel isn't good, it's a <vocabulary>bad feeling</vocabulary>. You're <vocabulary>feeling terrible</vocabulary>, in fact.
readingMnemonic: The readings come from the words 気持ち and 悪い. Hopefully you've seen both and can combine them together to know the reading automatically. No bad feelings with this word, right?
